question.questionText: Which is denser, hot water or cold water? How can you tell from lowering vials of hot water and cold water into a cup of room temperature water?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Cold water is denser. Cold water sinks to the bottom of room temperature water. Hot water and less dense things float on room temperature water.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Cold. I know because things that are denser than water sink. The cold water sinks, so it is denser than room temperature water.
Hot. Hot water is denser than room temperature water because most of the hot water will go to the top of the cup.

Hot. Because hot makes water evaporate faster.
Cold water. I know this because when you put a cup of cold water into a cup that is room temperature it goes to the bottom, whereas warm water goes to the top.
Cold. If it was less dense it would have floated to the top like the block of wood question, but it did not so it is denser.
